text: [Music]
hello I'm conita a training program
manager at the AWS office in Cape Town
there are various reasons that a credit
or promotional code might not be applied
to your AWS Bill let's get
started first open the billing and cost
Management
console in the navigation pen on the
left choose
credit here you can view any active
credits that are applied to your account
if you don't see a credit it could be
due to the following reasons one the
credit code isn't active on your account
yet two the code is expired credits have
a start date and an expiration
date three you've already used the full
credit amount check previous month's
bills to see if the credit was applied
now let's look at other reasons that a
credit might not be applied to your
bll you added the credit code after the
current building cycle ended for example
if you add a credit on August 2nd it
won't apply to the July usage charges
credits added in August will apply to
the August usage charges and also
charges in the following months until
the credits are depleted or expire the
credit credit doesn't apply to the
services you're using each credit is
specific to certain AWS services and
these Services appear under applicable
products if you recently joined an AWS
organization credits might still be
applying to your previous account that
month credits apply to only one account
per billing
cycle credit sharing isn't activated for
your organization you must turn on
credit sharing to share credits across
accounts if the credit still isn't
applying after checking those then open
a case with AWS support for further
investigation so now you know the
various reasons that a credit or
promotional code might not be appli to
your AWS
bow thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
